Key Match Events: The Royals lost 3-1 in Game 4 of the ALDS to the Yankees.
Salvador Perez hit a homer in Game 2, leading the Royals to their only win in the series.
Michael Wacha allowed two runs on six hits in 4 2/3 innings in Game 4.
Gleyber Torres hit a first-pitch fastball for a double and scored on Juan Soto’s single in Game 4.
Lucas Erceg, the Royals' closer, was brought in during the fifth inning of Game 4 and allowed another run in the sixth.
The Royals' bullpen held the Yankees scoreless for the final three innings of Game 4.
Post-Match Reflections: Bobby Witt Jr. expressed disappointment and motivation for the future, stating, 'It just kind of feels like you let a lot of people down. Something that will light a torch in you.'
Michael Massey mentioned that the team proved to themselves they are capable of being a really good team.
Manager Matt Quatraro reflected on the urgency of playing against a strong team like the Yankees.
Vinnie Pasquantino expressed that despite an impressive season, the team felt they didn't do enough and it stings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals had a 30-win turnaround from 2023 to 2024, making the postseason for the first time since 2015.
The Royals became the third team in Major League history to make the postseason following a 100-loss season.
The Royals swept the Orioles in the AL Wild Card Series before facing the Yankees in the ALDS.
